alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 4:17PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Orleans, southeastern St. Tammany Parishes in southeastern Louisiana and southern Hancock Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 417 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Slidell, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Slidell, Bay St. Louis, Waveland, Diamondhead, Lake Catherine, Pearlington, Lacombe and Shoreline Park. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 261 and 266. Interstate 12 between mile markers 74 and 81. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
